title: I just got a 'low priority que'... again..
body:
last week I'd received a low priority que for "afking" because I'd dc'd and came back 5mins later and ended up winning the game..

since then I haven't afk'd or left a game. Today my power went out and I went 'afk' there wasn't a storm around so it was unexpected..
now I'm on another low priority que (for 10min this time) because something happened that was out of my control and I came back and we won the game..

should you be put on a low priority que even if you'd re joined the game?

It's one thing to leave the game intentionally but another to have something out of your control happen, then get punished for it

replies.body: Don't play with an unstable connection. You're in a low priority queue, not banned or anything.

my connection is fine apparently
telstra have checked numerous times yet it still disconnects every few days.. there's nothing I can do

does this mean I shouldn't be allowed to play league?

Telstra will tell you anything so they don't have to do anything. It's your responsibility to follow up and continue to troubleshoot your connection. If you disconnect every few days, then yes, you shouldn't be allowed to play League. It's just a selfish act to continue playing with the chance of completely ruining games.

When I had an unstable connection I had to quit League for 3 months until it was sorted out. LoL is my favourite game, and it killed me to do it, but I quit because I'm not an asshole.

Well, if the disconnections are a few days apart, it might be manageable. If you can determine which days it might happen the I'm sure you could find something else to do on those days until the issue has been resolved but it wouldn't be too easy to figure out when it'll happen. I suggest keeping track of your disconnections and seeing if you can find some kind of pattern. Also, is there anything else using the internet when the disconnections happen? Might be related to the problem.

I have.. They seem to be at random times but around every 3-5 days(sometimes more)
and no I'm not in a league match every time it happens so It's not a regular thing

@Xerioum I'd thought that might be the issue so a month ago I'd got a new router.. Still no change..

I've had someone from telstra have a look on our end, they've checked their end, I've got a new router yet it still disconnects at random times for no reason.. A few friends that live in the same area don't have this issue so it looks like I need to move house to play league?
All I can think of at this point is if it's an ADSL connection that you have a house phone using. Had a problem long ago with that, changed the phone and it was fixed.
Bigpond are lying %%%%s, you have to threaten to go to another ISP before they fix anything, took 2 months to get my net fixed last time.
You may need a new router, if u had urs for more then a year or 2 and this problem starts to occur its time to get a new one

That counts even when you actually come back into the game after d/c'ing?

That is kinda unfair if that's the case, unless the person has afk'ed more than 10 min or if the frequency of doing so is rather noticeable, he shouldn't get flagged into low priority queue.

In my opinion.

"You have been disconnected from chat, please hit reconnect to reconnect"
"You have been disconnected from chat, please hit reconnect to reconnect"
"You have been disconnected from chat, please hit reconnect to reconnect"
"You have been disconnected from chat, please hit reconnect to reconnect"
fking hate that

Anyways, when I get d'cd then come back in the game and win I never get low priority...
Winning the game has no, and should have no implications on punishment or not.
its not about winning, it's about the fact that I came back within a reasonable amount of time

Except it's not a reasonable amount of time.

Every 4-6 months or so I have a crash thanks to Windows updating in the background, and I'm down for about 2-4 minutes.
I think I should be punished for those 2-4 minutes out of a match, yet I'm not.
It's unfair for my team mates.
you should not be allowed to play league of legends because you crash every 4-6 months until you get that problem fixed
Did I not just explain that I am disappointed that I have received no Leaver Buster warnings for my actions?
have you tried not afking.
I call bull%%%%, you dont get low prio just by leaving 1 game, it does it to repeat offenders
read my original post.. I'd received a 5min low priority que around 5-7 days ago
you could try restarting the router every few days or so that worked for me when i was getting lagg spikes

You think that sucks, for some reason I couldnt connect to my game at all yesterday and spent 23 minutes CONSTANTLY TRYING to connect because it was clearly MY fault, and I got into a lower priority queue and have to wait 10 minutes before I can play a normal...all because this games launcher is so damn buggy.

Well in order to punish those who intentionally AFK/DC Riot needs to do something and, unfortunately, it means that people with less stable connections are at risk. There's no way for Riot or the leavebuster system to identify who's left a game intentionally and who's disconnected due to something out of their control and, even if they had something to detect that, it would be abuseable as people could just switch off their modems and avoid punishment. Unfortunately, because of the actions of some individuals, others who've done nothing wrong are at risk of punishment but I don't see a way to avoid that while still effectively punishing those who deserve it.
